required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Procalcitonin at Zero and 24 Hours as a Prognostic Factor in Patients With Pneumonia
clinical_study.official_title: Procalcitonin at Zero and 24 Hours as a Prognostic Factor in Patients With Pneumonia

brief_summary.textblock: Procalcitonin levels checked initially and at 24 hours will correlate with disease severity, morbidity, and mortality. Patients who have a higher procalcitonin level initially and at 24 hours will likely have higher qSOFA scores, longer lengths of stay, longer duration of antibiotics and higher 30 day mortality rates.

detailed_description.textblock: A procalcitonin order bundle will be created for admitted patients with pneumonia. This prepopulated bundle includes an initial and 24 hour procalcitonin level, much like the current initial and 4 hour lactate orders are set-up. These patients will receive treatment for their pneumonia as is deemed appropriate by their care teams, both in the Emergency Department and while an inpatient. Then, after discharge, the 30 day mortality, length of stay, choice of antibiotic therapy, and qSOFA score (which will be retroactively calculated) will be compared to the patient's initial and 24 hour procalcitonin level.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline and at 24 hours
primary_outcome.description: Change in procalcitonin level in the blood serum

secondary_outcome.description: qSOFA score is based on blow blood pressure, high respiratory rate, and altered mental status
Length of stay in days, total stay from admission until discharge
Number of patients who expire vs those alive at 30 days

arm_group.description: A procalcitonin order bundle will be created for admitted patients with pneumonia. This prepopulated bundle includes an initial and 24 hour procalcitonin level. These patients will receive treatment for their pneumonia as is deemed appropriate by their care teams, both in the Emergency Department and while an inpatient. Then, after discharge, the 30 day mortality, length of stay, choice of antibiotic therapy, and qSOFA score (which will be retroactively calculated) will be compared to the patient's initial and 24 hour procalcitonin level.

intervention.description: A procalcitonin order bundle will be created for admitted patients with pneumonia. This prepopulated bundle includes an initial and 24 hour procalcitonin level.

study_pop.textblock: All patients seen at Lakeland St. Joseph and Niles Hospitals in the emergency department and who are then subsequently admitted with pneumonia at Lakeland St. Joseph and Niles Hospitals

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients seen at Lakeland St. Joseph and Niles Hospitals in the emergency department and who are then subsequently admitted with pneumonia at Lakeland St. Joseph and Niles Hospitals
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any patients not admitted with pneumonia, any patients who are admitted with another primary diagnosis other than pneumonia, any patients who do not have an initial or 24 hour procalcitonin level result, and any patients less than 18 years old

overall_official.affiliation: Lakeland Hospitals at St. Joseph and Niles
